alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Jefferson; Orange (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 25 at 5:19AM CST until January 25 at 7:15AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CST THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHEASTERN HARDIN, JEFFERSON AND ORANGE COUNTIES... At 519 AM CST, Heavy rain is ending across the warned area, but area stream gauges show increased rises with some ditches and smaller bayous exceeding bankfull. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.1 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Beaumont, Port Arthur, Orange, Nederland, Groves, Port Neches, Vidor, Bridge City, Central Gardens, Hamshire, Mauriceville, Bevil Oaks, China, Rose City, Pine Forest, Lakeview, Southeast Texas Regional Airport, Port Acres, La Belle and Fannett. Elevated ditches and bayous with saturated soils will lead to flash flooding. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
